who.title: Who are we?
who.text: Since the beginning of our operations in 2013 at Latin American Certification & Systems (LACS), we have been committed to supporting organizations in Mexico through our management system certification and training services to facilitate their access to new markets and help them achieve their strategic objectives. Our staff has extensive experience in the application of conformity assessment standards and management systems. We stand out for our close approach to the client, providing active listening for timely attention to their needs. Through our service portfolio, we offer solutions that we are sure will contribute to the success of your organization.

mission.title: Mission
mission.text: At LACS, we are a multidisciplinary and experienced team that provides evaluation and knowledge transfer services, creating trust, value, and driving the development of our clients.

vision.title: Vision
vision.text: At LACS, we seek sustainable growth in national and international markets by implementing the best available technological practices, adhering to our institutional values.

0.title: Ethics
0.desc: Defined as human conduct, what is right and wrong, good living, morality, and duty. At LACS, integrity and responsibility are guidelines we establish as the basis of our actions.

1.title: Responsibility
1.desc: The ability to fulfill obligations, assuming the commitments derived from our decision-making.

2.title: Impartiality
2.desc: Our services and decisions are based on objective evidence and are not influenced by any particular interest.

3.title: Non-discrimination
3.desc: We treat suppliers or anyone related to LACS equally and provide our services guided by the values that govern us.

4.title: Persistence
4.desc: At LACS, we are firm and constant in our actions, with drive and effort despite obstacles and difficulties.

5.title: Passion
5.desc: At LACS, we are characterized by interest, motivation, and teamwork to face each project and challenge.

6.title: Confidentiality
6.desc: We guarantee that sensitive information from our suppliers and other stakeholders related to our services is used appropriately and responsibly and is not disclosed without authorization.

appeal.title: Complaints and Appeals Procedure
appeal.step1:
The client submits an appeal request with supporting information to the email
info@lacs.org.mx
appeal.step2: Receipt of the appeal is confirmed and its handling begins.
appeal.step3: The request is analyzed to determine its validity. If accepted, an analysis group is formed.
appeal.step4: The situation is analyzed by the group and, if more information is required, it is requested from the audit group or client. A resolution is issued.
appeal.step5: The resolution is communicated to the client and LACS operational staff.

iso9001.desc:
ISO 9001 is recognized worldwide as the standard for quality management. It is mainly aimed at meeting the expectations of customers of organizations of any size and sector, demonstrating their commitment to quality and continuously improving a management system that helps achieve objectives and goals.

With the implementation of ISO 9001, your organization, through the leadership of top management, implements effective processes and promotes staff training to provide products or services with the confidence of meeting your customers' needs.
iso9001.benefits_title: The benefits of implementing this standard are:

iso27001.desc: ISO/IEC 27001 is the world's best-known standard for information security management systems (ISMS). It provides companies of any size and sector with a framework to establish and implement actions to manage risks related to the security of the data they own or handle, in order to generate trust with their customers, partners, and the general public.
iso27001.benefits_title: The benefits of implementing this standard are:
iso27001.benefit3: Maintain the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of information
iso27001.benefit4: Establish security controls on all media
iso27001.benefit5: Protection throughout the company of the information it handles

iso37001.desc:
ISO 37001 is a standard dedicated to establishing a management system that helps organizations prevent, detect, and respond to bribery, as well as comply with anti-bribery laws and voluntary commitments applicable to their activities. It covers various forms of bribery (direct and indirect) in the public, private, and non-profit sectors.

The systematic approach of ISO 37001 provides organizations with a framework to combat bribery, not only through regulatory compliance but also by fostering a culture of integrity, transparency, and trust within organizations.
iso37001.benefits_title: The benefits of implementing this standard are:
iso37001.benefit1: Reduce the risks of bribery and its associated costs
iso37001.benefit2: Improve compliance with international anti-bribery laws
iso37001.benefit3: Increase stakeholder confidence in business operations
iso37001.benefit4: Strengthen the organization's reputation and integrity

step1.title: Request information
step1.desc: You can request information about our management system certification services through our communication channels.

step2.title: Service proposal
step2.desc:
With the information you provide, we will promptly send you our service proposal, indicating the concepts of our services: stage 1 and 2, certificate issuance, and surveillance audits.

The executive will follow up on our service proposal to learn your comments and determine if we will collaborate with your organization. If the service proposal is accepted, please send it signed; otherwise, let us know.

step3.title: Contract
step3.desc: Once the proposal is accepted, our executive will send you a service contract for your signature, which we ask you to review before signing.

step4.title: Stage 1 Audit
step4.desc:
Service scheduling
Once our service proposal is accepted and simultaneously with the signing of the contract, our operations coordinator will begin service activities by contacting you to set the dates for Stage 1 and 2.

Stage 1
In this stage, we will request information about your management system, send you a notification of the service date, and the Work Agenda with the schedules and processes to be evaluated. This stage consists of reviewing the planning documents of the management system. At the end of the audit, we will provide you with a report with the findings.

step5.title: Stage 2 Audit
step5.desc:
In stage 2, we will conduct a complete evaluation of your management system to determine compliance with the standard requirements. Our staff will interview personnel, review activity records, achievement of objectives, implementation of policies, etc.

At the end of the audit, our auditors will send you a report with the evaluation results. If there are non-conformities, we will inform you of the response time.

step6.title: Findings
step6.desc: At the end of the Stage 2 audit, if there are findings, the organization must prepare and submit the Action Plan within the first 15 calendar days, which is reviewed by the Lead Auditor, and 40 calendar days later, the organization sends the implemented actions for closing the findings.

step7.title: Decision making
step7.desc: Once stages 1 and 2 are completed, your file will be forwarded to the Technical Evaluation and Decision Committee for evaluation and decision on the certification of your organization's management system through a resolution.

step8.title: Issuance of certification
step8.desc: The Certification Body issues the certificate valid for 3 years, with the decision recorded in the resolution. Our staff will communicate this resolution to you. If positive, we will also send you a certificate draft for your approval, valid for 3 years.

step9.title: Maintenance audits
step9.desc: Throughout the validity of the certification, we will conduct annual audits to confirm the management system's compliance with the requirements of the standard implemented in your organization.

step10.title: Renewal audits
step10.desc:
The organization can renew its certification for another 3 years; the process is similar to the initial certification.
It is recommended to conduct the audit 3 months before the certificate's expiration date
- Renewal Audit is performed
- Findings are addressed (when applicable)
- Feedback is obtained from the audit team
- File is reviewed
- Decision to renew the certification is made
- A new certificate is issued with dates updated to the corresponding cycle

step11.title: Restoration audits
step11.desc:
When the organization does not renew within the established deadlines or is suspended for more than 6 months or canceled according to the conditions described in RCTED-02 Brand Use Regulation for LACS certified management systems
The certification may be restored within the following 6 months:

- Restoration Audit is performed
- Findings are addressed (when applicable)
- Feedback is obtained from the audit team
- File is reviewed
- Decision to restore the certification is made
- A new certificate is issued. (The certificate's validity date must be the date of the Restoration Decision, and the expiration date should be based on the previous certification cycle)
